data.title: The New York Times
data.text:
FRIEDMAN‐Laura, beloved mother of Natalie Auerbach, Dorothy Appleby, Harry, Minnaq Melssner, Charles and Evelyn, adored grandmother of eleven and great‐grandmother of ten. Services Friday 12 noon, Schwartz Brothers, “Forest Park Chapels', Queens Blvd. and 76th Road, Forest Hills.

GANZ‐Maurice M. Beloved husband of Rose. Devoted father of Sheryl and Bonnie. Dear brother of Ruth and Benjamin Ganz. Services Friday 1:30 pm “The Riverside,” 76th St. and Amsterdam Ave.

GANZ‐Maurice. Of 3901 Independence Avenue, Riverdale. Long time member of Mercantile Exchange. Beloved husband of Rose, father of Sheryl and Bonnie. Services at Riverside Chapel, 76 st and Amsterdam Ave Friday 1:30Pm

GOLD‐Harriet Hopp. On October 18th, wife of the late Ralph Gold. Devoted mother of Myron; sister of the late Philip Hopp, aunt of Audrey Well and Richard Hopp. Graveside service, Mt. Pleasant Cemetery, Pleasantville, N.Y. today Friday 11 AM. Contributions to Temple Israel, 112 E. 75 St, New York City, would be appreciated.

HAZAN‐Jack. Beloved husband of Elenore. Devoted father of Meryl Rosenblum and Stuart. Dear brother and loving grandfather. Services today 12noon in “Boulevard‐Park West” 1450 Broadway, Hewlett LI.

HENDRICKSON‐Theodore H. 72, of 6 Landing Road, Old Lyme, Connecticut, died October 17, 1979. Retired President of Theodore T. Hendrickson Company, Inc., a steel pipe distributor in New York City. Surviving are his wife Marjorie Clarke Hendrickson, one son, Theodore 0. Hendrickson, his one sister, Mrs. William L. Joyce of Brooklyn, New York. Memorial service on Friday, October 19th, at 2 P.M. St. Ann's Episcopal Church, Old Lyme, Connecticut. Please omit flowers. Contributions to the donor's choice.

JONES‐Harry W., suddenly on Monday October 15, 1979. of Vienna, Va. Beloved husband of Koula Jones, father of Anastasia Robinson, Harry W. Jones III, Kathryn A. Jones and Daphne Jones. Funeral services were held on Thursday, October 18, from the Colonial Funeral Home, Falls Church Va

KLEIN‐Ella Eichel, 92. Widow of John Klein. Passed away on Wednesday, October 17, 1979, in Palm Beach, Fla. Survived by sisters Ann Crowley and Frances Benjamin, both of West Palm Beach. Services will be held today (Friday) at 11am, from the Riverside Memorial Chapel, 180 West 76 St and Amsterdam Ave, N.Y. Interment will follow In the Riverside Cemetery, Rochelle Park, N.J.

KOHEN‐Herbert, on October 18, 1979, of 21 Berkshire Dr, Princeton Junction, N.J., beloved husband of Bette Fisher Kohen, devoted father of Miss Sheila and Harris, beloved son of Sylvia Traub Kohen, beloved brother of Edwin. Funeral services Friday October 19th at 1PM from the Congregation Beth‐Chaim, East Windsor, with Rabbi Eric Wesnia officiating. Interment Floral Park Cemetery, Monmouth Junction, N.J.

KOHEN‐Herbert. The Officers and Members of Temple Sinai of Roslyn record with sorrow the passing of the brother of our Executive Director, Edwin A. Kohen. Our condolences to the family. Rabbi Norman Kahan Raymond S. Hack, President

KYLE‐Steven‐Adored husband of Betty Comden Kyle and father of Susanna and Alan, brother of I solde White, October 17, 1979. Services will be held Friday, October 19, at 11:30AM at Frank E. Campbell, Madison Ave at 81 St. In Steven Kyle's name, donations for pancreas research may be made to Friends of Research in Digestive Diseases, Mt. Sinai Hospital, Attention Dr. Henry Janowitz. Please omit flowers.

LEFFERTS‐Halleck. Oct. 16 at Washington Hospital Center. Devoted husband of Sarah Barney. Beloved father of Cynthia, Charles and the late Barney Lefferts. Funeral service private. Sympathy may be expressed In the form of memorials to the Pomfret School, Pomfret, Conn. 06258.

MARSTON‐Hunter S. Died peacefully, October 16th at his home In Watch Hill, Rhode Island. Beloved father of Edgar L. , Elisabeth M. MacAdams, George V., and Hunter S., Jr. Private funeral arrangements.

McCULLOUGH‐Margaret E. Reposing Williams Funeral Home, 5628 Broadway at 232nd St, Bronx until Saturday, 9:30 AM.
